question_text: Which of the following are valid reasons to replace a laptopâ€™s entire LCD panel instead of just repairing the backlight? (Select all that apply)
answer_options: The screen uses a sealed LED backlight assembly
The panel shows multiple physical cracks
The inverter is socketed and easy to replace
The backlight is embedded and inaccessible without damaging the panel
The user prefers a brighter screen with a wider color gamut
correct_answer: The screen uses a sealed LED backlight assembly
The panel shows multiple physical cracks
The backlight is embedded and inaccessible without damaging the panel
explanation: If the panel is physically damaged or uses a sealed backlight assembly, replacing the entire unit is often more practical than repairing it.
